answers.answer: Yes it is possible.  Eating low carbs and exercising will reduce your A1c.  But I would not change my medication and exercise routine without consulting a Dr.  And I do not think it is possible to go forever without meds - just postpone it.

question: Read posting recently about diabetes 'reversal' and achieving A1C's under 5.0.  Being 'well controlled' for 2.5 years since diagnosis, holding A1C at 5.5-6.0 seasonally without medication (low-carb/slo-carb diet+exercise) I was not aware this was possible without medication.  What percentage of diabetics are sensibly not on medication (under 6.5-7.0, I guess), and what percentage of these are under 6.0, under 5.0?  At 59, is it reasonable to expect to live a long healthy life without ever going on meds?
title: No Meds for Life?
